intro: Trimorpha scotteri, commonly known as the Scottish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Scotland. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Trimorpha scotteri is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
